backend/main.mo: Defines an empty Motoko actor with no methods, serving as a placeholder backend.
feature_evidence.json: Structured report mapping implemented Valentine-themed frontend features to files, components, test IDs, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Human-readable index summarizing the purpose of key frontend source files and configuration.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base stylesheet defining CSS variables for layout, borders, charts, and light/dark theme tokens.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point that sets metadata, page title, and mounts the React app at the root element.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main single-page React component implementing the Valentine "fizza" experience with interactive Yes/No buttons, playful No behavior, and a celebratory Yes state using themed visuals and animations.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook that creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous backend actor using Internet Identity and React Query.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a context and hooks for managing Internet Identity authentication state, login, logout, and identity persistence.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Empty placeholder hook file indicating no backend queries are required and all state is handled locally.
frontend/src/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS defining the Valentine + pizza visual theme with OKLCH colors, custom animations, typography, and light/dark mode support.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application bootstrap that renders the React app with React Query and Internet Identity providers and loads global styles.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration enabling class-based dark mode, scanning frontend sources, and extending the theme with OKLCH-based design tokens, Valentine/pizza custom colors, fonts, radii, shadows, and animations. Includes plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Defines the project metadata and requirements for a single-page Valentine-themed "Will you be my valentine fizza" website, including interactive buttons, visual theme goals, and required generated images. Tracks existing features, pending requests, image specs, and overall project state.
